> > However there is one minor problem - the software is actually owned
> by the
> > Forgotten Sages, and thus you'll probably find that the copy we have
> > actually falls under the 'warez' category and so it's likely to be
> > prohibited by Yahoo :)
> > To get around that we simply need someone from FS to tell us we can
> upload
> > it, and maybe put a note somewhere in the groups online presence so
> Yahoo
> > doesn't go deleting it.
>
> Part of the solution is putting a password on the zipped file and use
> the same one for registered gladiator.  I can solve the rest of
> problem.  I am a member of the yahoo groups moderators list.  I'll
> send a personal email to the yahoo representatives there, explaining
> that we have permission to post the software there.

Alrighty, i'll password the file then.

> > Anyway, I'll try to upload it once FS gives us the go-ahead,
> hopefully my  modem connection won't fall apart part way through it -
> does anyone know if yahoo can resume transfers
>
> I doubt it.

So do I :)  HTTP isn't the greatest uploading transmission protocol ...

> BTW, how long will it take you to upload the file?  It's been taking
> about a minute or so to upload my scenarios to the group area.

Quite a while I'm guessing.  My connection isn't ultra-fast, nor is it
reliable (and even worse if it's via HTTP) so I may not be able to actually
get it up.  What I will do is dump it onto my webpage, and either try to get
Yahoo to retrieve it from that or let someone with cable/ADSL/Company T1
transfer it :)

I'll setup the upload tonight, I can resume the transfer to my ftp server so
it should go through without any troubles by tomorrow night at the latest.

Cya,
Deathifier
